title: - (Guam) Up to the spice point? - Mm-hmm.
subtitle: Hank Johnson said he feared that putting 8,000 Marines in Guam would make the island so densely populated that it would turn and collapse.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: :: During the House Committee meeting, Hank Johnson said he feared that putting 8,000 Marines on Guam would make the island "be so inhabited that it would turn and collapse."
